result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Bumpers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Submit a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

- Possess no firearms

Court ordered the weapon used in this matter forfeited.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D Bumpers

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Bond Refund Packet
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Trevor C. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191210 in court 2x on 1/27/16, 1/28/16.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box D284A
cf
2/4/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 1/28/16 for Trevor C. for 2 appearances on 1/27/16, 1/28/16.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Taylor Kraus and Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury returned at 1:00 pm for continued deliberations.  At 1:48 pm case called to address jury question.  At the hour of 2:44 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Taylor Kraus and Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury in box at 9:10 am.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Cody Smith - Shorewood Police Department. Jury out of box.  Arguments heard as to State's objection.  Jury in box.  Continued cross examination of Officer Smith.  Exhibit  1 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 9:43 am.  Defense motion for dismissal at close of state's case denied by the court.  Defense counsel advised the court that the defendant will not testify.  Court had colloquy with the defendant about his right to/not to testify.  Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Parties worked on jury instructions.  Jury in the box at 11:04 am.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 11:04 am.  Court instructed jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court instructed jury and charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:35 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Quiles who was duly sworn for that purpose.  Court released the jurors for lunch at noon.  Case adjourned until 1:00pm.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  1:55pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of box at 2:57 pm.  Jury in box at 3:15 am.  Jury panel sworn.  Court instructed jury.  Jury released at 3:28 pm for the day and instructed to return on January 28, 2016 at 9:00 am for continued jury trial in Branch 21.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

LATER SAME DAY.  CASE RECALLED.  ADA JOY HAMMOND NOW APPEARS WITH TAYLOR KRAUS FOR THE STATE.

Motions in Limine discussed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Case passed until 1:30 pm.

Filed:
*  State's Motion in Limine.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.   The Court is proceeding with another trial - no spin court available.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  First call.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on October 19, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  The State is unable to proceed and requested an adjournment; defense objects.  Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed:
*  Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on July 27, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant qualifies for public defender representation.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM022063  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/30/2015

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Brian D Bumpers in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Brian D Bumpers in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  
UPON RELEASED FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
